Text: Californians know the reality of extreme wildfires all too well. We need to reduce the risk of wildfire by passing legislation like the Wildfire Emergency Act to help harden infrastructure, train personnel and conduct large-scale forest restoration projects.

A new UN report estimates that even with significant reductions in carbon emissions, the world will still experience an increase of extreme wildfires in the coming decades. As we address the root causes of climate change, we must help communities prepare. https://t.co/gLaFxLKxtr

Putin’s unnecessary attacks make it apparent that he’s unable to accept a free and democratic Ukraine. The people of Ukraine have the right to a free and open government, and the United States should stand with them.

While we must seek to prevent a broader war in Europe at all costs, I strongly believe we must also support the defense of Ukraine with additional military equipment and reinforce our NATO partners with additional U.S. forces.

Vladimir Putin’s decision to invade is a brazen violation of Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity. The United States and our European allies must stand together with unity, strength and resolve to confront Russia’s aggression. https://t.co/rSyQtVtw4F

I’m glad to see some semblance of justice for the Women’s National Soccer Team after years of fighting for equal pay. I’ve long supported these athletes in their push for equality and am committed to seeing the same results for women athletes across all sports. https://t.co/WND1kCVG5S
Wishing everyone a happy #PresidentsDay! https://t.co/SJZudjOxLu

The United States stands with Ukraine and our NATO allies in the face of Vladimir Putin’s aggression. I join my colleagues in calling for Russia to de-escalate and reaffirm our commitment to impose swift consequences on Russia for any further military action against Ukraine. https://t.co/kMwatWCfst

The effects of climate change are well understood: rising sea levels, severe weather, devastating wildfires and crippling drought, to name a few. 

But one implication of climate change is often overlooked: threats to our national security. 

Read my op-ed:https://t.co/g1JRtAeuB8

The Affordable Care Act guaranteed that health plans must cover the full cost of birth control. Proud to join my colleagues to protect women’s access to free birth control and ensure health insurers comply with the law.

https://t.co/Xc93z91fWA

A new report from @NOAA predicts that sea levels on American coastlines will rise by an additional foot over the next 30 years. This latest report underscores why we must continue to do more to prepare for and confront climate change. https://t.co/atevSaCObE

One implication of climate change we must not overlook is our national security. 

The intelligence community and the Defense Department have taken some actions, as has Congress. But we must do more. 

Read about it here:

https://t.co/g1JRtAeuB8

Glad to see the Biden administration is working to help the American manufacturing industry reduce carbon emissions and produce cleaner products, including through green hydrogen. This set of actions will help spur this transition and advance efforts to confront climate change. https://t.co/99AGnBg0mg

I hope that today’s settlement will force Remington and other gun manufacturers to take a hard look at the role they’re playing in fueling the scourge of gun violence that plagues our country and stop producing these extremely deadly weapons.

Remington and other gun manufacturers have flooded our streets with assault weapons designed to kill as many people as possible as quickly as possible and then turned a blind eye to the carnage left in their wake.

I take some comfort in knowing that Remington has been held responsible for its role in the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School that killed 20 children and six staff members. But we must do more to remove weapons of war from our communities. https://t.co/PdoMqzf1k0

Governor @GavinNewsom’s nomination of 4th District Court of Appeal Justice Patricia Guerrero to join the California Supreme Court would make her the first Latina to sit on the state’s highest bench. Another glass ceiling shattered by a very well-qualified judge.

Our bipartisan legislation would end the corn ethanol mandate. It no longer makes sense when better, lower-carbon alternatives are readily available. We need to support electrification and more advanced biofuels that don’t contribute to climate change.

https://t.co/iBIYaI6VI6

This new study provides further evidence that corn ethanol mixed into gasoline creates more carbon emissions than regular gasoline. As we reduce our dependence on fossil fuels, we need to end the use of corn ethanol to mitigate damage to our climate. https://t.co/cv1rRv5ZwK

We’re urging the Labor Department to expedite the creation of a special unit to process federal firefighter compensation claims. These firefighters put their lives at risk and they deserve our support. Read our letter here: https://t.co/qFSqvjUOlA

Four years ago today, 14 students and three staff members were murdered at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida. We owe it to the victims and their families to pass commonsense gun safety legislation.
Congratulations to the Rams on bringing the Lombardi Trophy back to California!

With the Olympics now well underway, I’m rooting for all our U.S. athletes, particularly the 30 Olympians from California. And to those who have already won medals, like Chloe Kim from Torrance, great job! We’re rooting for you! 🇺🇸

Congratulations to Fresno native Ryan Christopher Jones and Berkeley High’s Julian Brave NoiseCat for winning the American Mosaic Journalism Prize for reporting on underrepresented groups. @rcjonesphoto @jnoisecat 

https://t.co/r3R6dyBbHK

Nearly half of cancer cases and deaths are preventable. By taking steps like eating healthy, wearing sunscreen and exercising, certain types of cancer can be prevented. Learn more about what you can do:

https://t.co/1xQ5wNplG2

I am proud to cosponsor this bipartisan bill, and I am happy to see my colleagues overwhelmingly support it on the floor today.

https://t.co/C3u0h2YXc3

Forced arbitration clauses protect predators and prevent survivors from seeking justice in the courts. Even more troubling, forced arbitration clauses have been used to silence survivors of workplace sexual assault and sexual harassment, and that is unacceptable.

I was proud to support and cosponsor legislation to end forced arbitration clauses in cases of sexual assault and harassment. This bill is critically important in supporting survivors who have experienced sexual assault and sexual harassment in the workplace.

The Biden administration’s announcement that it will invest nearly $57 million on electric vehicle charging stations in California is great news for our state. California already is leading the way to a net-zero carbon future and this will greatly help that effort. https://t.co/LT40sGMnuI

The American people deserve to know more about the U.S drone program and its effects around the world. I strongly believe that greater transparency is required and we need to reinstate an annual report regarding the number of strikes and civilian deaths. https://t.co/n9KoG7Qmoi

We’ve been working for three years to reach this agreement and reauthorize #VAWA. This bill provides important protections to survivors of domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault and stalking. I hope the Senate will move quickly to pass it. https://t.co/GbiWWFlP79
Our press conference on efforts to reauthorize and modernize the Violence Against Women Act is starting now. Watch here: https://t.co/xEVNC6tBFt

Filing your taxes online is the quickest way to get your refund. Thanks to President Biden’s American Rescue Plan, this year you may be eligible for a larger return, including the earned income tax credit and child tax credit.

https://t.co/dcYzxj9fbc

The child tax credit significantly reduced child poverty last year by putting more money back into parents’ pockets. Be sure to file your taxes soon in order to receive the full child tax credit as quickly as possible.

https://t.co/rJAoqhv2ns

I’m honored to have received a 100 percent rating from @CivilRightsOrg on their 2021 report card. Last year saw many successes including making our judicial system more representative of our country by confirming qualified judges at the fastest pace in four decades. https://t.co/ZMLnAZPMgR

Today’s job report reinforces the fact that under President Biden, the economy has rebounded rapidly. With 467,000 jobs created in January and 700,000 more new jobs in November and December combined than was previously reported, it’s clear our economy is recovering. https://t.co/vPRGUin512

On #RosaParksDay, we remember her immense courage and strength that helped spark the civil rights movement. Her story and the fight for civil rights is American history that all students must learn. #BlackHistoryMonth

Today is National #WearRed Day, a day meant to raise awareness of the number one killer in the United States, heart disease. Take a moment today to learn about the risk factors that cause heart disease and the best ways to prevent it. #AmericanHeartMonth

https://t.co/TP0v7liKfo

On #WorldCancerDay, let’s recommit to our common goal of eliminating cancer. I’m grateful to President Biden for reinvigorating the Cancer Moonshot project and I know Congress stands ready to assist in any way we can.

I’m proud to have authored legislation to create and reauthorize the Breast Cancer Research Stamp, which has raised more than $90 million since 1998 to fund breast cancer research. But we must do more.

With my colleagues on both sides of the aisle, we have worked to raise awareness about cancer, ensure health insurance covers no-cost cancer screenings, remove cancer-causing chemicals from everyday items and expand lifesaving research.

It’s unconscionable that in 2022 there are an estimated 40 million victims of human trafficking and slavery. I’m glad the Senate passed our resolution to raise awareness of this tragic issue and encourage everyone to become educated about this problem.

https://t.co/v7gASNwLYO

Cancer is the second leading cause of death in the United States, responsible for more than 600,000 deaths per year. However, thanks to the president’s initiative, that number will continue to decrease and we can eventually defeat the more than 100 diseases we refer to as cancer. https://t.co/dB6ScMC91w

I’m hopeful that one day others won’t have to suffer the effects of cancer or know the pain of losing a loved one to it. Congress will, no doubt, be a willing partner in providing funds and any legislative authority needed for this effort to succeed.

I’m thankful that President Biden has reinvigorated the Cancer Moonshot with the goal of cutting the death rate in half within 25 years and eventually eliminating cancer. Like President Biden and millions of Americans, this is deeply personal to me.

A 2020 estimate found that there were more than 5,500 wells that have been abandoned or are at high risk of being abandoned in the near future in California. This funding is a good start to capping these abandoned gas and oil wells.

https://t.co/eYJF8drFP2

I welcome the Biden administration’s announcement that it plans to spend nearly $5 billion to cap abandoned gas and oil wells in the United States. This will create good-paying jobs while protecting our communities from decades of toxic pollution.
Wishing all the best to Senator Lujan and his family. I look forward to seeing him back in Washington once he makes a full recovery.
Happy #LunarNewYear to all celebrating! Wishing everyone a great #YearOfTheTiger.

Congratulations to Dr. Laurie Leshin on being named director of NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory at Caltech, the first woman to hold that position. JPL has always been at the forefront of space exploration and I can’t wait to see all the great work under her leadership. https://t.co/LRsN7Bh91u

This month we celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth, a time to shine a light on the countless achievements and contributions of Black Californians and Americans around the country. Take some time this month to explore Black history. There are many great resources, including @NMAAHC. https://t.co/z0v3ijLZPX

With tax season underway, it’s important to be aware of potential scams. The IRS will never demand immediate payment with prepaid debit or gift cards or call unexpectedly about tax refunds. Find more information about tax scams here:

https://t.co/uyShDQp85o

Last week I joined my colleagues in calling for a permanent repeal of the Global Gag Rule. This rule prevents organizations around the world that provide essential health services from receiving U.S. funds.

https://t.co/pf5mPEakmf

CALIFORNIA: Today is the last day to sign up for health insurance through @CoveredCA. Thanks to President Biden’s American Rescue Plan, more Californians are now eligible to receive financial assistance. Find more information and sign up here:

https://t.co/mWu8aFaru4

The Covered California open enrollment period ends Monday. If you need to sign up for health insurance or would like to switch your current plan, head to https://t.co/aXIlXoF6UJ to review your options. You may be eligible for financial assistance.

We’re encouraging the Transportation Department to boost federal funding for the Caltrain Peninsula Corridor Electrification project. This project will create the state’s first electrified commuter rail system, connecting San Francisco and San Jose. https://t.co/MP1vEBfAia

When filing your taxes this year, be sure to check if you’re eligible for the Earned Income Tax Credit. Low- to moderate-income earners are eligible for this credit. Find more information here:

https://t.co/IAB459NxeC

A record number of Americans have signed up for health care this year. The Affordable Care Act and President Biden’s American Rescue Plan have made insurance available and more affordable for millions. Californians, you have until January 31 to sign up through @CoveredCA. https://t.co/e4awzy5RTK

Equal rights for women shouldn’t be delayed because of an arbitrary deadline. Now that enough states have ratified the Equal Rights Amendment, it’s time for it to go into effect so that women are finally provided equal protection under the Constitution.

https://t.co/hhDReb5rdO

California’s energy-efficient building standards are a model for the rest of  the nation, which is why last year I encouraged the Biden administration to build off the great work the California Energy Commission has done in implementing these standards. https://t.co/qY4wxTvNwa

California led the nation last year with 431 LEED certified projects. These certifications recognize buildings that are designed to be green, efficient and sustainable. To effectively fight climate change, we need to increase construction of LEED buildings.https://t.co/tZaUGj4E6b

With 6.4 million jobs created last year and Q4 GDP growth even higher at 6.9 percent, there’s great momentum behind the American economy. I’m confident that under President Biden’s leadership, we’ll continue to see great improvement.

New data shows that the U.S. economy grew by 5.7 percent last year. That means President Biden’s first year in office saw the strongest economic growth since President Reagan was in office. https://t.co/Z6dugpPJkO

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, take a moment to remember the millions of Jews and other victims who were systematically murdered during the Holocaust. We must always confront antisemitism to ensure this incomparable tragedy never happens again.

With reports that Justice Breyer will leave the court this summer, a successor can be named, members can review their record, the committee can hold hearings/vote and the Senate can be ready for final confirmation with AMPLE TIME left before his departure. This is a top priority.

With six months until Justice Breyer departs the court, the Senate Judiciary Committee will have ample time to hold hearings on President Biden’s nominee. I look forward to this process and trust President Biden will name a worthy successor to fill Justice Breyer’s seat. https://t.co/ykvmygbJYS

Justice Stephen Breyer has served with distinction as a federal court judge for more than four decades including 27 years on the Supreme Court. Most notably, Justice Breyer was a consistent defender of abortion rights. He will be greatly missed.

I encourage my colleagues to support the Kobe and Gianna Bryant Helicopter Safety Act. This important legislation will help update FAA standards to ensure helicopters are outfitted with terrain safety equipment.

https://t.co/cNzmPSkDhF

On the second anniversary of the tragic helicopter crash that killed nine individuals including Kobe and Gianna Bryant, we must continue efforts to ensure tragedies like this never happen again.

https://t.co/sO7RGk1TbA

California’s clean energy production and efforts to electrify transportation and buildings lead the nation. That’s why I’m encouraging the California Public Utilities Commission to incentivize the adoption of rooftop solar and storage while keeping rates reasonable. https://t.co/CG13GT8UEI
Ensuring that March will be home to the KC-46 is very good news for the local community as it signals a long-term commitment to the base’s future. https://t.co/6aRevLm0Np

I’m delighted that the Air Force has chosen March Air Reserve Base in Riverside County as its preferred location to base 12 KC-46 air refueling tankers. This is an incredibly important decision for March and for Riverside County.

When filing your 2021 tax return, make sure you have all necessary documents to obtain an accurate return. Stimulus and child tax credit payments may affect how you file your taxes. Find information on needed documents here:

https://t.co/prZzWa1X7P

We’re urging Secretary Haaland to expand protections for lands that can be classified as Wilderness Study Areas. This would be a good step forward for the Biden administration to reach its goal to protect 30 percent of lands and waters by 2030. https://t.co/SnclPYgKCq

Free at-home rapid Covid-19 tests are available to order at https://t.co/KLQm3R5Bht. Every household is able to order up to four tests. These tests are critical to helping curb the spread of the virus so be sure to order yours soon.

Be sure to file your taxes online as soon as possible to get your refund quickly. Find more tips from the IRS on how to navigate tax season here:

https://t.co/prZzWa1X7P

On the 49th anniversary of the Supreme Court correctly deciding Roe v. Wade, the threat to reproductive rights has never been higher. We must pass the Women’s Health Protection Act ASAP to #ProtectRoe and the rights it guaranteed.

Reproductive rights mean all women can access safe, essential health care. Every woman deserves the ability to consult with her doctor and make the best health care choices. We must #ProtectRoe to protect these rights.

Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure bill, the Army Corps of Engineers will invest nearly $173 million to improve infrastructure in California so we’re better prepared for the effects of extreme weather and sea level rise.

https://t.co/slfaJtsV3G

I led a group of my colleagues to call on members of the U.S. Conference of Mayors to ban ghost guns. These untraceable weapons make it harder for local police departments to do their jobs. Every city should pass an ordinance banning them.

https://t.co/94h5buXbHP

Water is the lifeblood of California, but climate change is making this valuable resource increasingly scarce. Reclamation’s plan will allow us to use our water more efficiently to ensure we have enough to meet our state’s future needs.

https://t.co/07iTMS65yu

The Bureau of Reclamation has released a plan to invest $1.66 billion in the first year of a five-year commitment of $8.3 billion to improve water infrastructure in California and the West. These funds will help restore canals, improve conservation and recycling efforts and more.

Judge Holly Thomas is an experienced appellate litigator and state court judge. I’m glad the Senate has confirmed her to a seat on the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals, the second Black woman to serve on the court and the first from California. https://t.co/TXGXyieyzJ

We must address the threat of wildfire with the seriousness it deserves. I will continue to push for additional funding and rapid implementation of programs to ensure we are doing all we can to mitigate the risk of devastating wildfires in California.

https://t.co/ykn5tL5s0u

Importantly, the Forest Service plan calls for the removal of hazardous fuels that feed fires from 75 million acres of forestland, triple the 25 million acres typically treated over the same time period. Much of this work will be focused in at-risk communities in California.

I’m pleased the U.S. Forest Service has released its 10-year implementation plan to confront the wildfire crisis in the West. This plan expands the work that will be done and focuses on areas at greatest risk for wildfire, an approach that will benefit California.

The Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act are critical to safeguarding sacred and fundamental right to vote. We’ve seen dozens of laws enacted across the country over the last year that make it harder to vote. That can’t be allowed to stand.

If Republicans want to block voting rights legislation, I believe they should stand on the Senate floor and explain to the American people why that’s the case, even as the right to vote is under attack in statehouses across the country. Then we vote. 

https://t.co/ZCYwV16Mv1

Testing is key to helping prevent further spread of Covid. Thanks to the Biden administration, every American household is now eligible to order free at-home rapid tests through the Postal Service. Information on how to place an order is available here:

https://t.co/Gxg2zH4dBu

Congratulations to Kristin Crowley on being the first woman nominated to serve as chief of the Los Angeles Fire Department. I’m glad Mayor Garcetti has made this historic nomination. https://t.co/0olcPj5a2h

Dr. King was instrumental in passing the first Voting Rights Act. As we remember his life and legacy this #MLKDay, let's recommit ourselves to ensuring everyone has the right to vote and can easily cast their ballot.

California has more than 1,500 bridges that are in desperate need of repair. Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure bill, we will receive $4.2 billion to increase the safety, stability and lifespan of our state’s bridges. https://t.co/V2e1guZAO0

SAN DIEGO: Blood banks in hospitals around the county are running critically low. If you are able to, please consider donating blood to a local blood bank. Information on where to donate is available here: https://t.co/J2rBpb2Njd https://t.co/qgc9fYkbmO

President Biden’s bipartisan infrastructure bill is a big win for California. I look forward to seeing cities across the state, like San Diego, benefit from the projects this landmark bill will help fund. https://t.co/Ed2xYqe7rJ

LA Metro has operated throughout the pandemic so essential workers can get to their jobs and individuals can get to vaccine and health care appointments. I’m glad to join @SenAlexPadilla to announce $1.2 billion from the American Rescue Plan for LA Metro.

https://t.co/HMVTYWRVaa

The IRS is bracing for enormous challenges this tax season. The pandemic and budget cuts have created major delays in processing tax returns and answering taxpayer questions. Ahead of tax season, we need to give the IRS emergency funding. https://t.co/4CHaH9pYPe

Check to see if you’re eligible for financial assistance when you sign up for health care through @CoveredCA.

The deadline to sign up for new coverage or switch your existing plan is January 31.

https://t.co/yrmsOe9Uo0 https://t.co/OAuFvnTKD7

One relic from the war in Afghanistan remains: the indefinite detention of prisoners at Guantanamo Bay. Closing Guantanamo won’t be easy. But now that the war in Afghanistan is over, it’s time to shut the doors on Guantanamo once and for all. Read my op-ed:https://t.co/GbSHB2ogtn

The @USCG is implementing important new boat safety rules. Last year’s passage of my bill, the Small Passenger Vessel Safety Act, is a step in the right direction, but we must continue efforts to ensure a disaster like the Conception boat fire never happens again. https://t.co/shozruDhBX

Climate change is increasingly threatening the U.S. financial system. In 2020 alone, climate change-fueled disasters cost us nearly $100 billion. I hope Chairman Powell will speak to how we can mitigate climate financial risk at his hearing before the Banking Committee tomorrow. https://t.co/DTUtv3HWr1
Governor Newsom is right to prioritize the Covid-19 pandemic and climate change in his 2022 budget. https://t.co/4YDox0f3im

Covid-19 booster shots have been authorized for everyone 12 and older. The CDC recommends that adolescents receive a Pfizer booster shot 5 months after the completion of their primary vaccines. Consult your health care provider if you have additional questions. https://t.co/6WQHwk99XZ

Businesses and residents affected by the Caldor Fire have until February 7 to apply for a federal disaster loan from @SBAgov. Californians in Alpine, Amador, El Dorado, Placer and Sacramento counties are eligible.

https://t.co/LNSXO49Al6

This program was created thanks to President Biden’s American Rescue Plan that Congress passed last year. Find more information, check to see if you qualify and apply here:

https://t.co/WF4KZPxveU

California has unveiled a program to help homeowners who have fallen behind on mortgage payments. To qualify for the California Mortgage Relief Program, there are certain requirements including having been financially impacted by the pandemic. https://t.co/vkI5xVb2hz

Californians are still dying unnecessarily each day due to the virus and life remains far from normal. These deaths and disruptions can be prevented but we must all do our part.

https://t.co/VEXK3NcLWA

We can’t let our guard down on the hope that the omicron variant is less deadly than previous variants. It is extremely contagious and has rapidly spread in the United States – including among vaccinated individuals.

California is now experiencing more than 50,000 new Covid-19 cases per day, up from an average of fewer than 10,000 before the holidays and more than any other point since the pandemic began. This dramatic rise in cases is being driven by the highly contagious omicron variant.

If you have questions regarding your 2021 tax return, the IRS can help. Information on selecting a tax preparer, setting up direct deposit to get your refund faster, using the interactive tax assistant and more is available here:

https://t.co/T1ZQ3u0sN6

The attack on the Capitol was not a peaceful protest.

Led by violent insurrectionists, it was an attack on our democracy with the goal of preventing a peaceful transfer of power.

https://t.co/z3cySZQPWo

That’s why we must pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. They will help ensure that our elections remain free and fair, that all Americans can vote and that election results are upheld. The foundation of our democracy is at stake. https://t.co/zhzTKS60Zk

The attack was planned, promoted and carried out by those seeking to thwart the results of a free and fair election. Sadly, those attacks have continued in the form of laws to suppress voting and create new pathways for partisan officials to subvert election results.

One year ago tomorrow, our democracy came under attack. Make no mistake, this wasn’t a peaceful protest. They brought weapons and used them to overrun police barriers, injuring nearly 140 officers. Nine people died as a result of the insurrection, including five police officers.

Congratulations to Captain Amy Bauernschmidt on becoming the first woman to command a U.S. aircraft carrier! The USS Abraham Lincoln deployed from San Diego under her leadership on Monday. https://t.co/XKJt4NYbG6

As tax season gets underway, it’s a good time to review the Taxpayer Bill of Rights. When dealing with the IRS, you have numerous rights including the right to appeal, the right to privacy and more. Find it here:

https://t.co/lZ9ScWyPjf

We must do all we can to prevent nuclear war and a new arms race. We must also hold the line on the proliferation of nuclear weapons. President Biden and the other major nuclear powers are right: A nuclear war cannot be won and must never be fought.

https://t.co/1xMjDbWncP

Too many children have easy access to firearms and can harm or kill themselves or others. I applaud the Biden administration for issuing a new rule that requires gun sellers to certify they have secure gun storage and safety devices available for sale to the public. https://t.co/QR7Bw1kUKk

One of my fondest memories of Harry was at the very first Lake Tahoe Summit in 1997, where he and President Clinton helped shine the spotlight on one of our national treasures. His work to preserve Lake Tahoe is one of many achievements over his long career.

Harry had an uncanny knack for politics and was as tough as they come, often telling stories of his years as an amateur boxer. He left a huge imprint on the Senate and understood how the chamber worked better than anyone.
I’m saddened by the passing of Harry Reid, who left an outsized mark on our country and his home state of Nevada.

For those who haven’t been vaccinated or received a booster shot, the time to act is now. 

With the rapid increase in cases, the potential to become infected and further spread the omicron variant is incredibly high. https://t.co/PGIdSHbKQB

Those numbers are expected to climb – experts warn that infections and hospitalizations could increase dramatically following the holidays. 

It’s critical that we continue to follow public health guidelines, which we know help limit transmission of this disease.

California is now seeing nearly 15,000 new Covid-19 cases every day, a five-fold growth in just one month.

And hotspots like Los Angeles are seeing even faster spread, with new cases up 450 percent in just two weeks.

And this morning Dr. Fauci again expressed his support for such a mandate. Vaccines are the best tool we have to fight this virus and they should be required to board a plane. I have a bill to create this requirement ready to be voted on.

https://t.co/Ni0gTFBXRb

The LA Times editorial board last week explained why this is an important step for the United States to take. We already have similar requirements for international flights. It’s time to extend that mandate to all flights. 

https://t.co/OwvqUfeH4q

With air travel returning to pre-pandemic levels, it’s vital we do everything possible to prevent further spread of Covid-19. Last week we sent a letter to the CDC and FAA encouraging a vaccine or negative test requirement for all domestic flights. https://t.co/chmOuWmEfd
Happy Kwanzaa to all celebrating! May this holiday be joyous as we look forward to another year.
Merry Christmas to those celebrating in California and around the world. I hope you have a great holiday!

CALIFORNIANS: Check to see if you are eligible for this program and learn more about it here:

https://t.co/6MbUFFtBlg

The Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program is a vital lifeline for families to keep their homes warm in the winter. We’re urging Secretary Becerra to address the rising cost of home heating and its impacts on this important program.

https://t.co/3YK3xuxOPy

I recently joined with my colleagues to urge the Biden administration to continue providing relief during the pandemic for those with federal student loans. I applaud today’s announcement that the president is extending the pause on student loan payments through May 1. https://t.co/1H8xuHnuDY

In the past year, the Senate has confirmed more judges than the first year of any administration in the last 30 years and we look forward to working with the White House in the upcoming session to confirm even more qualified judicial nominees.

https://t.co/lvHAG59lRq

The slate of judges confirmed to fill California vacancies on the federal courts is proof that President Biden and Senate Democrats are keeping their promise to make the federal bench more representative.

We welcome this news and look forward to working with the administration to reinstate California’s waiver under the Clean Air Act, and working together to advance the next set of ambitious standards for model year 2027 and beyond.

https://t.co/1B5c0LuRgm

Yesterday’s action by the EPA to finalize strong vehicle emissions standards will put us back on the path to reducing harmful emissions from the transportation sector while addressing the leading cause of climate pollution nationwide.

We’re pleased that California’s access to transit grants has been restored and we look forward to ensuring the state receives its fair share of transit funding to advance projects and sustain good-paying jobs.

California is making it easy for everyone to get both the flu shot and a Covid-19 booster shot at the same time. With Christmas quickly approaching, make sure that you’re protected against serious illness and death by getting vaccinated. 

https://t.co/q3QRzUstET

Happy #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth! As we celebrate the achievements and resilience of the Indigenous people of this land, so too do we reaffirm our commitment to protecting tribal sovereignty and uplifting the voices of California’s Tribal Nations & Native communities.

The SF Bay Water Quality Improvement Fund will receive $24 million. I helped create this program in 2008 to help fund projects that work to restore the bay’s wetlands and watersheds and reduce pollution runoff.

$17 million will go toward an ongoing aquatic invasive species and watercraft inspection program in Lake Tahoe that we created in 2008. This program has had much success fighting invasive species in the lake, and this funding ensures the program will continue.

The supply chain issues we’re currently seeing are a direct result of our nation’s lacking infrastructure. This bill allocates $17 billion for port improvements and $25 billion for airports to address maintenance backlogs.

This bill will significantly boost clean energy programs. It includes $65 billion for electric grid infrastructure, $19 billion to deal with cleaning up orphaned oil wells and $7.5 billion for more electric vehicle charging stations.

@metrolosangeles @SFBART More than 30 million Americans, including at least 545,000 Californians, live in regions with no useful broadband infrastructure. This bill provides California with at least $100 million to expand and improve internet access, stability and speed.

Public transit projects will receive $39 billion, including $8 billion for the Capital Investment Grant Program, which will help projects like LA Metro’s West Santa Ana Branch and Sepulveda Transit Corridors and BART’s extension to Silicon Valley. @MetroLosAngeles @SFBART

California will receive $25.3 billion for highways and $4.2 billion for bridge repairs and replacements. Currently, 1,536 bridges and more than 14,220 miles of highway in California are in poor condition.

Another $2.5 billion will go toward the Twenty-First Century Dams Act, including $875 million for dam safety projects at nonfederal dams, $800 million for hydropower dam retrofits and upgrades and $890 million for removing unneeded dams and restoring fish runs on rivers.

The Bureau of Reclamation will get $3.2 billion to help reduce the backlog of infrastructure repairs. And there’s an additional $500 million for federal dam safety projects that would allow for seismic repairs to one of California’s key water delivery hubs.

Another $1 billion will go to water recycling projects, helping stretch water supplies without increasing diversions from waterways or harming the environment. $250 million will be spent on desalination projects, providing a drought-proof water supply.

The infrastructure bill will help address California’s drought. $1.15 billion will go toward water storage projects to hold more water in wet years and after major storms for use by communities and for environmental benefit.
The infrastructure bill also contains $3.5 billion to help homeowners fireproof their homes. This is critical as California will continue to see large, wind-driven wildfires in the future.

Wildfire mitigation projects, including hazardous fuels reduction and prescribed burns, on federal lands will receive $3.3 billion. $5 billion will go toward burying power lines to reduce risk of fire and reduce disturbances caused by power shut offs.
It will also transition 1,000 seasonal firefighting jobs to permanent, year-round positions. This is important as climate change has extended the traditional fire-season to be year-round.
$600 million will go toward increasing salaries for federal firefighters, helping narrow the salary gap that makes it hard to recruit and retain wildland firefighters in California.

We must take action at every level of government to remove ghost guns from our streets. Passing commonsense legislation on the matter is something both Democrats and Republicans should support. No one should accept the presence of untraceable firearms in our communities.
